thread.title: Ailing Dodgers announcer Vin Scully will not broadcast during postseason
thread.title_full: Ailing Dodgers announcer Vin Scully will not broadcast during postseason | Newsday

author: ANTHONY RIEBER
title: Ailing Dodgers announcer Vin Scully will not broadcast during postseason
text:
LOS ANGELES - Hall of Famer Vin Scully underwent an undisclosed medical procedure Thursday and will not broadcast in the postseason, the Dodgers announced.
Scully, 87, had been scheduled to call the Dodgers-Mets NLDS that begins Friday night on radio.
Scully missed the final series of the regular season with what the Dodgers called a cold.
Story The Dodgers' New York connections Story Kershaw looking for playoff improvement "He's looking forward to returning to the Dodgers for the 2016 season, his 67th with the Dodgers," the team said in a statement.
Scully has said he will retire after the 2016 season.
